alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms are impacting southwestern Otero, northeastern Dona Ana, northwestern Hudspeth and northeastern El Paso Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 342 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a number of strong thunderstorm over the Otero Mesa, and portions of the Highway 54 cooridor between Orogrande and Alamogordo. These storms are moving toward the northeast. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and nickel size hail. In addition, gusty outflow winds will likely cause areas of blowing dust and dangerous driving conditions along highway 54. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Blowing dust will make for difficult travel. Locations impacted include... White Sands National Monument, Orogrande, Alamogordo, McGregor Range Base, Holloman Air Force Base, Boles Acres, Oliver Lee State Park and The Otero Mesa. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 176 and 207. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 6 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
